This happens every time after upgrading to latest 3.3 integration build. Tried troubleshooting by unzipping M5 on top of it but behaviour persists.

Apart from the bug itself- is there any chance to reanimate my install?

I'm running M5 fine on XP. Make sure that you have not installed eclipse M5 over a previsously existing install.
Closing for now. Please reopen if the problem persist.

Launching with clean shows the same problem. If I shouldn't copy over existing installation- how could I keep my settings (at least the update sites), potentially the installed plugins? It's a pain to reinstall everything again all the time.
Shouldn't copying over existing install work, too? All the new pacakges should be present?
I've tried with clean plugins and features directories as well as with clean workspace specified on command line- result is the same crash every time.

Found that I can revive the old installation when removing the configuration directory and using the new one from M5 instead. Of course, my update sites etc. are gone then.
So, the bug could be closed in terms of startup crash, but I'd be most interested in what the proper upgrade procedure is. Piling up masses of integration builds in the same folder eats the disc space, starting from scratch is inconvenient.
Any good pointers on that?
